description.narrative:
Burkina Faso II - Power Sector Reform Project - Institutional Strengthening Activity: The activity has two sub-activities:
1) Strategic and Institutional Framework Development Sub-Activity which will: strengthen the strategic direction and structural framework for Burkina Faso's power sector, including a plan for the possible reorganization of the Ministry of Energy, and creation of dedicated institutional capacity and coordination mechanism for IPP project development, such as an IPP unit within the Ministry of Energy; Monitoring and Evaluation component among sector institutions; development of an optimized framework for sector planning, and definition of the required institutional coordination; development of strategic national electrification and energy efficiency plans; and assistance to the Ministry of Energy and Mines and related electricity-related agencies and utilities (e.g. SONABEL, ABER, ARSE, ANEREE) to draft, adopt, and incorporate into everyday practice a comprehensive Environmental, Gender and Inclusion Charter detailing high level commitments.
2) Strengthening of the Regulatory Framework Sub-Activity which will: technical assistance to support the implementation of key regulatory reforms; modification of existing and/or creation of new decrees (secondary legislation) that cover the mandates and authorities of sector institutions, including the Ministry of Energy, the regulatory authority for the energy sector (ARSE), the utility (SONABEL), and the rural electrification agency (ABER); develop a model concession contract, to be adopted for the nearly 200 rural electricity cooperatives (COOPELs) currently in operation throughout the country; encourage private sector investment in off-grid service delivery, a regulatory framework for mini-grids will be further developed, introducing more flexibility compared to the current framework; foster regional integration and effective cross-border power trade; and provision of technical assistance to harmonize Burkina Faso's policies and standards with those of the West African Power Pool (WAPP).
